# ARObjectScanningConfiguration

**Class**

A configuration that recognizes objects and collects high-fidelity data about specific objects using the rear-facing camera.

## Declaration

```swift
class ARObjectScanningConfiguration
```

## Overview

To create an app that recognizes objects in the physical environment, first you scan them during development using `ARObjectScanningConfiguration`. After you’ve scanned an object, call [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/createReferenceObject(transform:center:extent:completionHandler:)] to turn it into an [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARReferenceObject] that you can use to detect it again at run-time. When users run your app, you ask ARKit to look for your scanned obects by running a world tracking configuration and assigning reference objects to its [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARWorldTrackingConfiguration/detectionObjects] property.



## Creating a Configuration

- **init()**: Initializes a new object scanning configuration.

## Enabling Plane Detection

- **planeDetection**: A value specifying whether and how the session attempts to automatically detect flat surfaces in the camera-captured image.
- **ARWorldTrackingConfiguration.PlaneDetection**: Options for whether and how the framework detects flat surfaces in captured images.

## Managing Device Camera Behavior

- **isAutoFocusEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether the device camera uses fixed focus or autofocus behavior.

## Inherits From

- ARConfiguration

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
